description: The growing local and global population is increasing world food demand. As Singaporeâ€™s population is projected to reach 6.9 million by 2030, it faces significant food security challenges considering that most of its food supplies are imported. How will we feed our population under these challenges? This module covers the history of food security in Singapore and the Southeast Asian region, sustainability of current practices and challenges (growing threat of climate change, export bans, pandemics, impacts on biodiversity conservation) facing Singapore now and in the next 50 years. This module will include field trips to agrotechnology facilities and guest lectures.
title: Food Security and Sustainability
